213.summary: Methane is one of the most harmful greenhouse gases emitted by industries around the world, but as Tina Kraus reports, a company in England has found a way to turn the climate change culprit into not just one, but two incredibly useful products.

214.title: How shuttering USAID could impact famine, lives in Sudan
214.summary: President Trump's efforts to shutter the humanitarian agency, USAID, could have drastic impacts on places like war-torn Sudan. The stoppage could mean less medicine for the sick, fewer first responders and more famine. Warning, the images in this story are graphic.

215.title: Palestinians and Israelis respond to President Trump's Gaza plans
215.summary: Palestinians and Israelis are reacting to President Trump's proposal for the U.S. to develop the Gaza Strip amid Israel's ceasefire with Hamas. While some, like Israel's defense minister, have praised Trump's proposal, many oppose the idea. CBS News' Chris Livesay has more.

216.title: Mona Lisa will have its own room after Louvre renovation, but it will cost more to see
216.summary: The renovation at the Louvre Museum in Paris will see the famed Mona Lisa moved to its own, separate space, where it will be easier to manage the crowds. However, visitors will have to purchase an extra ticket to see the work of art.

217.title: Investigation targets online groups accused of child sex abuse, torture
217.summary: Two men have been arrested for their roles in what authorities called "extremist" online communities.

218.title: Cocaine "no worse than whiskey," Colombia's president says
218.summary: Cocaine "is no worse than whiskey" and is only illegal because it comes from Latin America, said Colombian President Gustavo Petro, whose nation is the world's biggest cocaine producer and exporter.

219.title: One of Europe's most-wanted fugitives spotted at religious service
219.summary: Jos Leijdekkers — also known as "Omar Sheriff" and "Chubby Jos" — is accused of trafficking cocaine and ordering a murder.

220.summary: Sudan's civil war is starving millions of civilians, who rely largely on foreign aid that has come from the U.S. more than anywhere else.

221.summary: USAID worker says "everyone is really scared" at agency after being locked out; Hubble Telescope captures cosmic collision from 50 million years ago

222.title: January 2025 was hottest January on record despite factors working against it
222.summary: The world set yet another monthly heat record in January, despite an abnormally chilly U.S., a cooling La Nina​​ and predictions of a slightly less hot 2025, the European climate service Copernicus says.

223.title: Scientists say they've produced world's first IVF kangaroo embryo
223.summary: Australia-based scientists say they've produced the world's first kangaroo embryo through IVF and hailed it as a key step toward saving endangered marsupials.

224.title: As Trump ends USAID missions, officials fear Ebola outbreak in Uganda may spread
224.summary: Americans are among those exposed to the virus in Uganda.

225.title: Trump's comments on Gaza draw backlash as Palestinians return home after ceasefire
225.summary: President Trump drew backlash when he suggested the United States should take control of the Gaza Strip and move Palestinians out during a news conference with the Israeli prime minister at the White House. Chris Livesay reports that Mr. Trump is floating the idea as many Palestinians return home under the ceasefire deal.

226.title: Trump's aid freeze will worsen Sudan famine and cost lives, workers say
226.summary: Some of the humanitarian aid USAID provided went to the African nation of Sudan. For two years now, its people have been caught in the middle of a civil war between two warlords. Debora Patta got a rare look inside the country.

227.title: USAID worker says "everyone is really scared" at agency after being locked out
227.summary: USAID personnel have been locked out of their offices and email since Monday, leaving many confused as to whether they'll have healthcare or paychecks coming. One staffer spoke anonymously to Margaret Brennan, calling the shakeup by the Trump administration a "moral atrocity."

228.title: Guest finds seal sleeping in her hotel room in the Netherlands
228.summary: A guest at a beachside hotel found a surprise visitor in her hotel room when she came back from an evening walk.

229.title: What are the risks of a U.S.-China trade war, and can conflict be averted?
229.summary: The world's two biggest economies are on the brink of an economically destructive trade war. Here's what experts think could happen next.

230.title: Scientists digitally "unroll" ancient scroll scorched by Mount Vesuvius
230.summary: Researchers used advanced technology to digitally "unroll" an ancient Greek text on carbonized papyrus, and now they're reading it.

231.title: Nissan shares plunge on report of merger with Honda turning south
231.summary: The struggling Japanese carmaker is withdrawing from talks, the Nikkei business daily and other local media reported.

232.title: Takeaways from President Trump's statement on U.S. taking over Gaza Strip
232.summary: CBS News national security contributor Sam Vinograd joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to discuss President Trump's idea for the U.S. to  "take over the Gaza Strip," which would displace millions of Palestinians.

233.title: National security adviser on President Trump's proposal for Gaza Strip and U.S. intervening
233.summary: National security adviser Mike Waltz joined "CBS Mornings" to talk about President Trump's proposal for the U.S. to "take over the Gaza Strip," which he mentioned in a press conference Tuesday. Waltz discussed where the Trump administration stands on U.S. policy that supports a two-state solution.

234.title: Thousands flee Santorini as earthquakes hit popular Greek island
234.summary: Experts say the Greek island of Santorini has been hit by more than 1,000 earthquakes, but they're not linked to the region's active volcanoes.

235.title: Palestinians outraged over President Trump's proposal, saying it brings back painful memories
235.summary: Inside Gaza, President Trump's idea to take over the Gaza Strip has been met with outrage and resistance by Palestinians as they begin moving back to what's left of their homes amid the ceasefire with Israel. CBS News' Chris Livesay has more.

236.title: Trump falsely states these two Olympic female boxers ‘transitioned’
236.summary: Before signing an executive order trying to ban transgender women and girls from competing in female school sports, President Donald Trump claimed two boxers from the Paris 2024 Olympics “transitioned” as female, and “stole” titles from biological women. This statement refers to Algeria’s Imane Khelif and Taiwan’s Lin Yu-ting, and there is no evidence either boxer is anything but a cisgender woman. Vedika Bahl explains in this edition of Truth or Fake.
236.author: Vedika BAHL

237.title: France announces creation of 35 new data centres as AI summit kicks off
237.summary: France's digital minister has announced that 35 sites were ready to host data centres in the country, as the global AI summit opens its doors. It's an opportunity for Emmanuel Macron to show France is a key contender on the world stage when it comes to AI. Speaking to France 24, Meta's chief AI scientist Yann Le Cun said the success of Chinese AI company DeepSeek was a warning to OpenAI that "they aren't as ahead as they think they are, or at least not for very long."
237.author: Camille KNIGHT

238.title: Ukraine's options: How to maintain US support in the age of Trump?
238.summary: What goes for Greenland and Gaza also goes for Ukraine?With the third anniversary of Russia’s all-out invasion approaching and Kyiv on the back foot, allies scrambling to figure out the ‘art of the deal’ power plays of a U.S. president they thought they already knew. Do you placate or push back? Ukraine’s president’s been showing transactional flair by vaunting his country’s rare minerals in exchange for protection from Putin.Zelensky who now openly contemplates what Trump wants, direct negotiations with Moscow. We’ll review terms and conditions and - on the day that France delivers its first Mirage jets to Kyiv - the degree of volatility the coming weeks and months may bring for Ukraine and for a Europe that’s still divided over whether to weene itself off its reliance on the United States for its own security.
238.author: François PICARD

239.title: ‘Political stunt’: Feasibility of Trump plan in limbo as first migrants are sent to Guantanamo
239.summary: US President Donald Trump’s plan to house 30,000 undocumented migrants at Guantanamo Bay gained pace this week as the first flights arrived on the island off the coast of Cuba. As administration officials debate the legality of the plan and others warn of human rights abuses, its very feasibility is also under question.
239.author: Khatya CHHOR

240.title: Is 'masculine energy' needed in order to pursue innovation in AI?
240.summary: As AI action summit kicks off in Paris, FRANCE 24's tech editor, Peter O'Brien meet Yann LeCun, chief AI scientist of Meta, to talk about innovation.
240.author: FRANCE24

241.title: France: New divisions among left-wing coalition after no confidence vote
241.summary: France finally has a budget, after the government pushed the bill through by decree, and went on to survive a no confidence vote. But the episode has fractured the left wing opposition. The left emerged the largest group in parliament after last Summer's snap election, the different parties coming together in a bid to keep the far-right out of government, but the hard-left France Unbowed party says the Socialists have "deserted the trench"
241.author: FRANCE24

242.title: Binyamin Netanyahu calls Donald Trump's Gaza plan 'remarkable'
242.summary:
Israel’s defense minister says he has instructed the army to prepare plans for large numbers of Palestinians to leave the Gaza Strip in line with President Donald Trump’s proposal for the war-ravaged territory.

Defense Minister Israel Katz said Thursday the plan “will include options for exit at land crossings as well as special arrangements for exit by sea and air.” FRANCE 24's senior reporter, James Andre has more.
242.author: FRANCE24

243.title: Israel orders army to prepare 'volontary' departures from Gaza
243.summary: Amid international condemnation, Donald Trump has spelled out more of his idea for the United States to take ownership of the Gaza Strip and resettle the Palestinians elsewhere. He said that Israel would "turn over" the territory when fighting was over, and no US troops would be needed on the ground. Earlier, Israel's Defence Minister welcomed Trump's suggestion, and said he had ordered the Israeli army to prepare a plan to allow residents to leave Gaza voluntarily.
243.author: FRANCE24

244.title: Panama's president hits back at US 'lies' about free canal access
244.summary: Panama has vehemently denied claims made by the US on Thursday that its government vessels would have free passage through the Panama Canal, calling the US claims “lies and falsehoods”.
244.author: NEWS WIRES

245.title: Could Trump force Jordan and Egypt to take Palestinians deported from Gaza?
245.summary: US President Donald Trump’s demands for Jordan and Egypt to take in what could be millions of Palestinians deported from Gaza under the president’s stated plan for the devastated territory have been met with a fierce backlash from the Arab world. But with both nations deeply dependent on US military and economic aid, Washington could bring a lot of pressure to bear on the beleaguered countries.
245.author: Paul MILLAR

246.title: AI Action Summit: Can Europe catch up with the US and China?
246.summary: Political leaders, tech executives, scientists and experts are gathering to Paris to discuss the future of artificial intelligence. Summit host France dreams of becoming a leader in the disruptive technology. Back in 2018, President Emmanuel Macron launched a national strategy to mobilize €2.5 billion in public and private funds to develop homegrown applications. But competition is fierce, and the US and China have a particularly strong lead over European firms. FRANCE 24's Charles Pellegrin talks to France's special envoy for the AI Action Summit, Anne Bouverot. In addition to being mandated with organising this event, she also presides over France's commission on artificial intelligence and has had a long career as a tech executive and researcher.
246.author: Charles PELLEGRIN

247.title: Meet the 'Grannies' taking on Germany's far-right AfD
247.summary: With Germany set for general elections in which the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) could make historic gains, a group called “Omas Gegen Rechts” or “Grannies Against the Right” are taking to the streets in to persuade voters to reject extremist politics. The group, who use songs, puppet shows and even self-written “granny” raps to reach out to the public, is made up of politically active older people who say their mission is to defend democracy, diversity, and the rule of law.
247.author: FRANCE24

248.title: What are the expectations of Syria and France on the wake of the Paris summit
248.summary: French President Emmanuel Macron congratulated Syria’s newly installed interim President Ahmad al-Sharaa in a phone call Wednesday and invited him to visit France “in the coming weeks,” al-Sharaa’s office said in a statement. FRANCE 24's journalist Wassim Nasr has more.
248.author: FRANCE24

249.title: Greece's Santorini hit by fresh series of quakes, declares state of emergency
249.summary: Greek authorities declared a state of emergency for the island of Santorini on Thursday after an unprecedented series of undersea earthquakes shook the popular island for nearly a week.
249.author: NEWS WIRES

250.title: Smartphones: A lifeline or a dangerous distraction?
250.summary: On World No Mobile Phone Day, we take a look at how this event started and was named in honour of a famous French song. We also dive into which nations are most on their smartphones and which are not. Finally, we discuss what smartphone use could be doing to our society.
250.author: Solange MOUGIN

251.title: Red carpet glam, Cannes jury reveal and zombie animals in new French animation
251.summary: In this edition of arts24, we're bringing you all the excitement from the world premiere of "Bridget Jones: Mad About the Boy" in Paris. Join us as Renée Zellweger, Hugh Grant and Chiwetel Ejiofor light up the red carpet, with FRANCE 24's Dheepthika Laurent reporting from the event.
251.author: Eve JACKSON

252.title: Donald Trump signs order to ban trans athletes from women's sports
252.summary: Rights groups have slammed the latest executive order from the US president.. This after Donald Trump banned transgender athletes from competing in women's sports. It's the latest move targeting transgender people since he's been back in power. Delano D'Souza has more.
252.author: FRANCE24

253.title: Donald Trump administration appears to walk back shock Gaza plan
253.summary: After international condemnation, US officials have begun to walk back president Donald Trump's suggestion that the United States should take ownership of the Gaza Strip and permanently resettle the Palestinians elsewhere.
253.author: FRANCE24

254.title: 'The Seers': Sulaiman Addonia on his tale of an Eritrean refugee in London
254.summary: An author who spent his early life living in a refugee camp in Sudan, his early teens in Saudi Arabia and then arrived in London as an underage unaccompanied refugee speaking no English, has told FRANCE 24 how he turned his life around, and how his books reflect the situations he has found himself in. Sulaiman Addonia went on to earn degrees in development studies and economics. His latest book "The Seers" tells the story of a homeless Eritrean in London, and the sexual encounters she faces as she tries to negotiate a foreign land. He spoke to us in Perspective ahead of his appearance at the Paris bookshop Shakespeare and Company this Thursday.
254.author: Stuart NORVAL

255.title: Protesters in cities across the US rally against Trump's policies
255.summary: From the East Coast to the West, thousands across the US are rallying in protests against Trump. In a movement called "50 protests in 50 states," Wednesday saw demonstrations nationwide outside state Capitol buildings, and protesters are denouncing Trump's plethora of recent executive orders that they say are "destroying their democracy." Meanwhile, protests also taking place in Washington DC, against Trump and billionaire ally Elon Musk's shuttering of USAID, the country's foreign aid agency.
255.author: FRANCE24

256.title: The ninth art: Exploring France's love of 'la bande dessinée'
256.summary: French people love comic books, known as bandes dessinées. That means that the "BD" industry is booming. Graphic novels are such an important part of French culture that there are several festivals around the country, including the prestigious Angoulême International Comics Festival. In the past few years, the place of women in the comic book world has been in the spotlight. After being underrepresented in the industry for decades, change is now underway. Finally, we take a closer look at France's attachment to satire in the graphic form.
256.author: Florence VILLEMINOT

257.title: Bangladesh protesters raze buildings linked to ousted leader
257.summary: Thousands of protesters in Bangladesh took out their anger at former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina by burning her family's former residence to the ground on Wednesday. Hasina fled to India last autumn after being forced to resign, but recently called on her supporters to oppose the Bangladeshi government, which sparked anger and outrage. Leo McGuinn has the details.

356.title: Trump's Plan for Gaza: American intervention and mass relocation
356.summary:
President Trump floated two stunning ideas about Gaza on Tuesday. The first is he said the U.S. would take over the territory, which has been devastated by the recent war.

And, he said the entire population of Gaza would be relocated to other countries. Trump offered no specifics for his plans sending Palestinians and Israelis scrambling to understand what he means.

President Trump's vague plan to "Make Gaza Beautiful Again" could signal the largest shift in US-Middle East policy in decades and could upend widespread hope for a Palestinian state alongside Israel.

402.title: 'He said he loved me': Victim of Sweden attack rang fiancee one last time after being shot
402.summary: One of the victims of the attack on an adult education centre in Sweden rang his fiancee one last time after being shot to tell her he loved her.

403.title: Greece declares state of emergency on Santorini after earthquakes
403.summary: Greece's authorities have declared a state of emergency on Santorini after a series of earthquakes shook the popular tourist destination.

404.title: British woman, 24, dies after 'hostel fumigated for bed bugs'
404.summary: A British woman has died on holiday in Sri Lanka after a room in her hostel was fumigated for bed bugs, local police said.

405.title: Hottest January on record shocks scientists
405.summary: Last month was the warmest January on record, according to new data.

406.title: Ancient scrolls near Pompeii were preserved but unreadable - are they now revealing their secrets?
406.summary: Ancient scrolls charred by a volcanic eruption 2,000 years ago may finally be starting to reveal their secrets.

407.title: Why are South African HIV clinics closing because of Trump?
407.summary: 👉 Listen to Sky News Daily on your podcast app 👈

408.title: Man arrested on suspicion of killing pigeon
408.summary: A man has been arrested in Tokyo on suspicion of killing a pigeon that he reportedly filmed himself abusing.

409.title: Sweden gunman 'had links with education centre where he killed 10 people'
409.summary: The gunman who killed 10 people and wounded several others in Sweden may have been connected with the adult education centre where he opened fire, police have said.

410.title: 'He started shooting towards me': Sweden attack survivor describes moment he escaped classroom
410.summary: "I was in the classroom and someone suddenly came in. I saw him, I saw the shooter. As soon as he entered, he'd started shooting. Six, five times. So I started running."

411.title: Almost 3,000 people killed in Democratic Republic of the Congo fighting
411.summary: Almost 3,000 people have been killed in fighting in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), the UN has said.

412.title: Opinion: Trump wants to extend the 2017 tax cuts. Here's how that would affect regular Americans
412.summary: Especially if they come with reductions to Medicaid, food stamps and other safety net programs, the policy will make the rich richer and leave most worse off.
412.author: William Gale

413.title: In Syria, the fighting is over, but a resource-rich region is left in limbo
413.summary: The eastern province of Deir al-Zour, which remains divided between Syria's new government and a Kurdish-backed militia, is a hostage to competing ambitions.
413.author: Nabih Bulos

414.title: 5 Europeans, in the country illegally, stole funds meant for low-income L.A. families, U.S. says
414.summary: Five men were arrested in L.A. on suspicion of using counterfeit EBT cards to withdraw funds intended to provide food and aid to low-income families, the Department of Justice says.
414.author: Clara Harter

415.title: A tariff loophole is closing. Why that matters for Shein, Temu and other Chinese online retailers
415.summary: A decision by President Trump to close a tariff loophole could change the landscape of online shopping, particularly for the Chinese e-commerce companies behind wildly successful sites, such as Shein and Temu.
415.author: Marisa Gerber

416.title: News Analysis: The Trump administration's budding bromance with El Salvador's leader
416.summary: Salvadoran President Nayib Bukele offered to let Trump move immigrants who are imprisoned in the U.S. to his notorious detention centers in El Salvador.
416.author: Tracy Wilkinson

417.title: Trump's call for U.S. takeover of Gaza hits wall of opposition
417.summary: Trump reimagines Gaza as a 'Riviera' without Palestinians. Israel's Arab neighbors say no to that.
417.author: Laura King, Nabih Bulos

418.title: How Trump could pave the way for China in Latin America
418.summary: China has begun to challenge U.S. hegemony in Latin America. The chaos of the Trump presidency may present it a new opportunity.
418.author: Kate Linthicum, Stephanie Yang

419.title: 'Shadow government'? Billionaire Elon Musk's grip on U.S. government spending raises questions
419.summary: Billionaire Elon Musk was the focus of many in Washington this week, as his Department of Government Efficiency slashed at the federal bureaucracy.
419.author: Kevin Rector

420.title: Can Elon Musk shut down a federal agency? Yes, if presidential rule replaces constitutional governance
420.summary: Musk's takeover of USAID tests the principle of constitutional rule versus presidential power.
420.author: David G. Savage

421.title: Senate panel vote clears the way for Kennedy to become health secretary
421.summary: A key Senate committee supports Robert F. Kennedy Jr., President Trump's pick to head the Department of Health and Human Services. The full Senate will vote on his nomination.
421.author: Seema Mehta, Karen Kaplan

422.title: Column: Many will lie about the consequences of Trump's tariffs. The markets won't
422.summary: When the president announced tariffs on China, Canada and Mexico, stocks tumbled, responding to economic realities that politicians and their supporters often ignore.
422.author: Jonah Goldberg

423.title: 'My home has become a cemetery.' Amid cease-fire, Gazans unearth their dead from rubble
423.summary: A Palestinian woman who lost 10 children and her husband shelters in her shattered Gaza home, where four of her youngest remain buried under rubble.
423.author: Bilal Shbair, Laura King

424.title: Businesses close, children skip school for 'a day without immigrants' protest
424.summary: Organizers said they have tracked 250 businesses nationwide that were closed Monday in solidarity with immigrants.
424.author: Andrea Castillo, Malia Mendez, Cindy Carcamo, Gustavo Arellano

425.title: ACLU sues Trump administration for shutting down asylum process at southern border
425.summary: Trump's executive order sought to dismantle asylum at the southern border. Lawyers say it has been illegally extended to migrants inside the country.
425.author: Rachel Uranga

426.title: California breathes sigh of relief with delayed tariffs on Mexico and Canada. China remains in play
426.summary: Stocks largely recover from an early tumble after Trump confirms one-month delay in imposing tariffs on Mexico. But tariffs on China remain in play.
426.author: Don Lee

427.title: Mexico and Canada reach deals with Trump, but China tariffs loom
427.summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Monday that their countries have avoided hefty U.S. tariffs — for now.
427.author: Kate Linthicum, Patrick J. McDonnell

428.title: Column: Trump is creating an imperial presidency — and he's doing it by decree
428.summary: Trump has been back in the White House for two weeks and is already remaking the federal government — and trying to create an imperial presidency.
428.author: Doyle McManus

429.title: English words have invaded Korea. The government is fighting back
429.summary: How do you say "deepfake," "ASAP" and "digital" in Korean? The fight to keep foreign words from diluting the language
429.author: Max Kim

430.title: Thousands rally in downtown Los Angeles, shut down 101 Freeway to protest Trump's immigration policies
430.summary: Draped in Mexican and Salvadoran flags, roughly 1,000 demonstrators gathered near City Hall shortly before noon, blocking traffic at Spring and Temple streets.
430.author: Daniel Miller, Ben Poston

431.title: Column: A president who won't tell the truth about California may unfairly punish the state
431.summary: Trump's bogus claims about his popularity in the Golden State could be laughed off if he hadn't threatened tying wildfire relief to an overhaul of the state's election system. It's both reckless and cruel.
431.author: Mark Z. Barabak

432.title: Trump cuts chaotic path in first weeks, bucking laws and norms in pursuit of promised agenda
432.summary: President Trump in his first weeks back in the White House repeatedly bucked the Constitution in pursuit of his conservative agenda. Democrats decried the ensuing "chaos."
432.author: Kevin Rector

433.title: Mexico and Canada order retaliatory tariffs on U.S. after Trump starts trade war
433.summary: President Trump announced sweeping tariffs on goods imported from Mexico, Canada and China, triggering a trade war and raising fears about consumer costs.
433.author: Kate Linthicum, Don Lee

434.title: This French film about Mexico has 13 Oscar nominations. Why 'Emilia Pérez' is tanking in Mexico
434.summary: Although it's set in Mexico City, French film 'Emilia Pérez' ran into a frost reception on its opening there. Critics cited stereotypes and the lack of a clear message about the narcos it portrays.
434.author: Patrick J. McDonnell, Cecilia Sánchez Vidal

435.title: Trump and the L.A. fires have made for nonstop news. Experts share ways to deal, not reel
435.summary: Experts said many people today feel overwhelmed by the news, but there are ways to reduce such anxiety, in part by reducing scrolling.
435.author: Kevin Rector

436.title: CDC scrubs research databases referencing sexual orientation and gender identity
436.summary: Health researchers began sharing warnings on social media several days ago, urging members of the community to make copies of federal data before the information was removed from the CDC website.
436.author: Corinne Purtill, Karen Kaplan

437.title: Rubio carries anti-immigration message to Latin America in first trip overseas as Trump's top diplomat
437.summary: Rubio has to balance aggressive Trump policies with Latin America's willingness to cooperate. The Panama Canal will be contentious.
437.author: Tracy Wilkinson

438.title: Another unwelcome consequence of climate change: an explosion of urban rats
438.summary: Global warming is worsening droughts, making sea levels rise, and fueling deadly storms. Now scientists have a new problem to add to that list: Climate change is helping rat populations thrive in U.S. cities.
438.author: Karen Kaplan

439.title: Trump's order on antisemitism and 'Hamas sympathizers' has California universities on alert
439.summary: Trump's executive order calling on campuses to address antisemitism has university leaders, faculty and students concerned as the president vows to revoke visas of pro-Palestinian international students who have taken part in protests.
439.author: Jaweed Kaleem

440.title: A fragile Gaza cease-fire holds for now, as Hamas frees eight more hostages
440.summary: Eight hostages held by Hamas militants are returned to Israel as Palestinian prisoner releases proceed — but can the Gaza cease-fire hold?
440.author: Laura King

441.title: Trump's orders have upended U.S. immigration. What legal routes remain?
441.summary: President Trump, in his first days in office, has released a series of executive orders that will reshape the country's immigration system. We lay out the key changes.
441.author: Jessica Garrison, Rebecca Plevin

442.title: As Trump cuts federal jobs, even national parks are on the chopping block
442.summary: As the Trump administration rushes to eliminate federal jobs, even the national parks — among the country's most beloved and least politicized institutions — are in the crosshairs.
442.author: Jack Dolan

443.title: A new Syrian government struggles to reset its corrupt, besieged economy
443.summary: With Syria's corruption-ridden economy in shambles after the overthrow of Bashar Assad, the caretaker government's priority is to raise cash and bring stability.
443.author: Nabih Bulos

444.title: These House newcomers came to the Capitol with big plans. Then the wildfires hit
444.summary: The California infernos were baptism by fire in Washington politics for Reps. Luz Rivas, George Whitesides and Laura Friedman.
444.author: Faith E. Pinho

445.title: Senators challenge Robert Kennedy Jr. on vaccines in confirmation hearing as health secretary
445.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faced aggressive questions about his skepticism of vaccines and other issues during the first of two scheduled Senate confirmation hearings.
445.author: Seema Mehta, Karen Kaplan

446.title: Is Trump pushing his presidential powers beyond what the Constitution allows?
446.summary: Trump is likely to succeed in expanding presidential powers on some fronts because the Constitution generally puts vast power in the hands of the president.
446.author: David G. Savage

447.title: There's a new royal baby in town: Britain's Princess Beatrice welcomes second child early
447.summary: Princess Beatrice, who is ninth in line to the British throne, has welcomed her second child with her husband, millionaire property tycoon Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi.
447.author: Nardine Saad

448.title: Column: No one polices men's bodies the way we police women's bodies
448.summary: As President Trump takes a hammer to reproductive rights, a Mississippi legislator proposes making it illegal to ejaculate without the 'intent to fertilize an embryo.'
448.author: Robin Abcarian

449.title: Column: Trump pardoned a lot of bad apples. Now he and Republicans own the barrelful
449.summary: Republicans have long styled themselves as the party of law and order and 'backing the blue,' but Trump freed people who attacked police. How does that make the country safer?
449.author: Mark Z. Barabak

450.title: Immigration arrests in churches? Some clergy say not so fast
450.summary: Churches took in refugees from battle-scarred Central America in the 1980s, a precursor to their current focus on undocumented immigrants.
450.author: Andrea Castillo

451.title: Chinese films dodging censors have no place to go. Can they crack into Taiwan?
451.summary: Taiwan is an ideal place for Chinese filmmakers to evade censorship. But the island democracy has its own restrictions on what Chinese films are allowed to air.
451.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

452.title: Low math and English scores mark the nation's report card, California and L.A. included
452.summary: Scores nationwide and in California have yet to rebound from pandemic-era declines. Some outcomes continue to get worse. Low math and English scores, California and L.A. included, mark the nation's report card.
452.author: Howard Blume

453.title: Will Mexico accept military flights of deportees? President Sheinbaum deflects on sensitive issue
453.summary: The Trump administration's use of U.S. military aircraft to return deportees has raised alarms throughout Latin America.
453.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

454.title: Federal judge blocks White House freeze on 'financial assistance' amid anger, confusion
454.summary: California will help lead a coalition of states in suing to block a White House budget office order halting "all federal financial assistance."
454.author: Kevin Rector, Faith E. Pinho, Emily Alpert Reyes

455.title: Goldberg: President Trump demands GOP unity. Here's why he might not get it
455.summary: Trump has left the Republican faithful scrambling to explain and defend his actions beyond blind cult-of-personality loyalty. With the slim GOP majorities in Congress, that's not politically manageable
455.author: Jonah Goldberg

456.title: Former Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff will split time between L.A. and New York in new legal job
456.summary: Questions about former Vice President Kamala Harris' plans have swirled since she lost her presidential bid — notably about whether the former California senator and attorney general will run for governor next year.
456.author: Seema Mehta

457.title: Justice Dept. halts legal programs for detained immigrants, cuts off advocates' access to facilities
457.summary: The suspension of advocates' access to immigrant detention centers eliminates most chances for detainees without a lawyer to receive basic legal information.
457.author: Rachel Uranga

458.title: With diminished clout, Californians in Congress struggle to counter Trump's agenda
458.summary: With little power in Republican-led Washington, D.C., California Democrats struggle to mount a countereffort to President Trump's agenda.
458.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

459.title: Thousands of Palestinians stream back to northern Gaza as cease-fire with Israel holds
459.summary: Israeli troops pull back but maintain a watchful eye on the tens of thousands of Gazans who had been displaced during the 15 months of fighting.
459.author: Nabih Bulos

460.title: As Colombia ends its immigration standoff with Trump, Mexico looks eager to avoid a clash
460.summary: Colombia attempted to stand up to Trump's immigration demands, with mixed results. Mexico appears to be playing it safer.
460.author: Kate Linthicum, Tracy Wilkinson

461.title: Calmes: Trump's focus on retribution distracts from the nation's real domestic enemies
461.summary: The new president's enemies aren't America's enemies. If the FBI turns to retribution, what will protect us from the real threats that endanger the nation?
461.author: Jackie Calmes

462.title: Trump and Biden add to long, strange history of presidential pardons
462.summary: Trump's clemency for Jan. 6 rioters and Biden's reprieve for family represent merely the latest chapters in an odd history of the presidential pardon.
462.author: David Wharton

463.title: Is Xavier Becerra's next move running for governor? He's not saying. Yet.
463.summary: Former President Biden's secretary of Health and Human Services is strongly considering running for governor of California, according to allies.
463.author: Seema Mehta

464.title: Trump punishes Colombia for refusing entry to deportation flights
464.summary: He slaps a 25% tariff on Colombian goods and imposes a raft of visa restrictions. Latin American nations are grappling with how to deal with Trump on his signature issue.
464.author: Tracy Wilkinson

465.title: Column: The rise of Silicon Valley, from indifference to lords of the political universe
465.summary: The assembly of billionaires at Trump's inauguration was a display of wealth and power unlike any before. The display was all the more remarkable given how recently many in tech were politically naive or apathetic.
465.author: Mark Z. Barabak

466.title: Trump talks 'free speech' while moving to muzzle those he disagrees with
466.summary: President Trump issued an executive order purporting to end government censorship. Critics scoffed, saying his actions do just the opposite.
466.author: Kevin Rector

467.title: California's growing need for caregivers could collide with a crackdown on immigrants
467.summary: The Trump administration's plans to crack down on immigration and launch mass deportations could drain caregivers from the workforce as California and the country face the needs of an aging population, advocates and experts say.
467.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

468.title: Abcarian: Does Donald Trump's return to power mean it's time to admit he's right? In a word, no
468.summary: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde's plea to Trump the day after his inauguration exemplified the principled criticism the president deserves regardless of his victory.
468.author: Robin Abcarian

469.title: Opinion: Trump promised to end the Ukraine war, but neither side is ready
469.summary: As Eisenhower once said of how conflicts end, 'sometimes it just gets down to the dirty job of killing until one side or the other cracks.'
469.author: ML Cavanaugh

470.title: Stranded in Mexico City, these migrants hoping to reach the United States have no good options
470.summary: The 1,500 migrants living in this Mexico City encampment face hard choices with President Trump in office.
470.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

471.title: Community groups set up strike teams to respond to Trump's mass deportation plans
471.summary: Community groups are dusting off the rapid-response networks they built during President Trump's first administration to prepare for immigration sweeps in California's agricultural heartland.
471.author: Rebecca Plevin

472.title: Visiting L.A. after firestorm, Trump focuses on overhauling California water policy
472.summary: President Trump says he plans to issue an order to 'open up the pumps' and deliver more water from the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta to California farms and cities.
472.author: Ian James

473.title: Supreme Court will decide if religious schools may be funded as public charters
473.summary: The Supreme Court agreed to hear a new church-state case that could yield a potentially momentous decision and change the funding of public schools in much of the nation.
473.author: David G. Savage

474.title: Trump revokes the security detail of Dr. Anthony Fauci, who has faced death threats
474.summary: Trump revoked the security for Dr. Anthony Fauci, the infectious disease expert and former advisor turned critic who faces regular threats to his life.
474.author: Associated Press and Times staff

475.title: Cease-fire in Gaza Strip was widely welcomed. It may not last. Here's why
475.summary: Powerful forces in Middle East and, now, in Washington working against truce lasting beyond its first phase.
475.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King

476.title: Opinion: It's now clear that America's death penalty is dying one generation at a time
476.summary: Capital punishment has continued to become rarer in recent years, and public opinion of the practice keeps growing dimmer with time.
476.author: Austin Sarat

477.title: Meet the first couples to wed as Thailand legalizes same-sex marriage
477.summary: Thailand has long been known as a haven for LGBTQ+ communities. It is only the third place in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage, behind Taiwan in 2019 and Nepal in 2023.
477.author: Stephanie Yang

478.title: Trump's rebuke to 'gender ideology' changes federal policy and sets up clash with California
478.summary: The executive order conflicts with laws in California and other blue states that forbid discrimination based on gender identity. The courts are expected to take up the issue.
478.author: David G. Savage

479.title: Under Trump, we could be flying blind when it comes to bird flu, other infectious diseases
479.summary: President Trump announced he's pulling the U.S. from the WHO. Now researchers are scrambling to understand what that means for the H5N1 bird flu pandemic.
479.author: Susanne Rust

480.title: Alawites wary as a post-Assad Syria takes shape
480.summary: Once Syria's most influential minority, Alawites struggle to move on from their association with a hated dictator.
480.author: Nabih Bulos

481.title: U.S. and Australia have long fought fires together. Climate change threatens joint efforts
481.summary: U.S. officials didn't even bother to ask Australia for help battling the Los Angeles fires.
481.author: Max Kim, Maria Petrakis

482.title: Less process than 'a traffic ticket': ACLU sues to stop Trump's fast-track deportation policy
482.summary: ACLU sues to stop Trump policy that allows immediate deportation of some immigrants. The new policy could pave the way for mass expulsions.
482.author: Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga

483.title: 'Scare tactic': Bonta slams Trump move targeting local officials over immigration
483.summary: The Department of Justice is planning to investigate and possibly prosecute state and local officials who hinder Trump administration immigration efforts.
483.author: Faith E. Pinho, Keri Blakinger, Ruben Vives

484.title: Calmes: President Trump's Jan. 6 pardons broke his promise to the nation
484.summary: The new/old president seems to have a memory issue. 'You will pay,' he told Jan. 6 lawbreakers in 2021. You're free to go, he said Monday.
484.author: Jackie Calmes

485.title: 'Freaked out': Fear, uncertainty grip California's immigrant community as Trump rolls out crackdown plan
485.summary: Worry spreads over what Trump's orders will mean for California immigrants. One in eight state residents are undocumented or live with a family member who is.
485.author: Ruben Vives, Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga, Rebecca Plevin

486.title: Biden, Harris in California, and soon Trump will be too
486.summary: Former President Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden are spending their first days after leaving the White House in Santa Barbara County.
486.author: Seema Mehta

487.title: Musk says his gestures at Trump inauguration event weren't Nazi salutes
487.summary: Musk made the gestures during a giddy speech celebrating Trump's return to power at a rally Monday at Capital One Arena in Washington. Many condemn the gestures, but not the ADL.
487.author: Kevin Rector

488.title: What did Trump's team learn from past legal battles? Immigrant advocates prepare to find out
488.summary: Immigrants rights groups are already contesting President Trump's sweeping executive orders aimed at combating illegal immigration.
488.author: Andrea Castillo

489.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
489.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
489.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

490.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
490.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
490.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

491.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
491.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
491.author: Robin Abcarian

492.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
492.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
492.author: Kevin Rector

493.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
493.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
493.author: Seema Mehta

494.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
494.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
494.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

495.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
495.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
495.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

496.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
496.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
496.author: Lila Seidman

497.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
497.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
497.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

498.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
498.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
498.author: Doyle McManus

499.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
499.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
499.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

500.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
500.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
500.author: Kevin Rector

501.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
501.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
501.author: Seema Mehta

502.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
502.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
502.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

503.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
503.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
503.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

504.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
504.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
504.author: A.T. McWilliams

505.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
505.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
505.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

506.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
506.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
506.author: Karen Kaplan

507.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
507.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
507.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

508.title: News Analysis: Once again, the world sizes up a Trump presidency
508.summary: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office again, the world watches with a sense that, this time, those outside the U.S. have a better idea what to expect.
508.author: Laura King, Tracy Wilkinson

509.title: Opinion: If Martin Luther King Jr. were alive, how would he have approached the Trump era?
509.summary: The president-elect's inauguration takes place on the holiday honoring the civil rights leader, prompting us to consider how King might respond to Trump's America.
509.author: Earl Ofari Hutchinson

510.title: Opinion: Experts once thought highly of Biden's presidency. Here's how his legacy is likely to change
510.summary: A year ago, a survey of presidential scholars put him in the top third of chief executives while Trump ranked last. But that was before the 2024 election and campaign.
510.author: Brandon Rottinghaus and Justin Vaughn

511.title: Trump's first inaugural speech was 'American carnage.' He says this time will be different
511.summary: Will Trump take the opportunity this time, in his second inaugural speech, to talk of unity? Or will it be more 'American carnage'?
511.author: Doyle McManus

512.title: Did Ivanka Trump receive USAID money for a White House event in 2019? Here's what records reveal
512.summary: According to documents, Ivanka Trump used over $11,000 from the department in 2019 to buy video recording and reproducing equipment for a White House event. The documents show $11,539 was to be used by Ivanka in November 2019 to purchase software, CDs, tapes and records. The purchase was approved by Jenifer Healy, who was serving as USAID deputy chief of staff at the time, and the Administrator's Office.
512.author: TOI World Desk

513.title: Terrorists kill 3 cops in Pakistan's volatile Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
513.author: Omer Farooq Khan

514.title: Donald Trump, Elon Musk's deferred resignation program for federal employees blocked: Here's what happened
514.summary: About 40,000 of the approximately 2.3 million employees eligible for the buyout offer have accepted it, according to NBC News and The Washington Post—after a figure of around 20,000 was reported a day earlier. CNN reported that Trump was planning a mass layoff of those employees who did not take the buyout.
514.author: TOI World Desk

515.title: Hillary Clinton blames MAGA for plane crashes, hopes Elon Musk's 'unvetted 22-year-olds' fix things fast
515.summary: Hillary Clinton and transport secretary Sean Duffy engaged in a heated exchange on X after two fatal plane crashes in the US. Clinton criticized Elon Musk's DOGE officials for lack of experience, while Duffy blamed Washington bureaucrats for infrastructure issues. Clinton linked the crashes to MAGA's policies, while Donald Trump targeted DEI hiring practices.
515.author: TOI World Desk

516.title: Bill Gates' warning about 'super smart' Elon Musk and shutting down of USAID
516.summary: Bill Gates has voiced his concerns about Elon Musk's decision to potentially shut down USAID, stating it could lead to millions of deaths due to its crucial role in global health initiatives. While Gates acknowledges Musk's innovations in the private sector and called him super-smart, he criticized Musk's support of far-right party in Germany.
516.author: TOI World Desk

517.title: New contingent of Kenyan police joins UN-backed mission to fight gangs in Haiti
517.summary: A fourth contingent of 200 Kenyan police arrived in Haiti to help fight violent gangs, joining over 600 others. Despite the US freezing $13.3 million in funding for the mission, commander Godfrey Otunge assured the mission is on track, with less than 3 per cent of support affected. The mission continues to receive aid from the US and other countries. Gangs control 85 per cent of Port-au-Prince, causing widespread violence and displacement.

518.title: 'Enemies list’ rocks Trump's FBI nominee Kash Patel's Senate confirmation; vote delayed
518.summary: US Senate Democrats have delayed the confirmation process for Kash Patel’s FBI Director nomination due to allegations of him promoting lists targeting Trump’s enemies. Senate Democratic leader Chuck Schumer expressed concerns over Patel's potential to undermine the FBI’s independence, sparking a need for a second hearing.
518.author: TOI World Desk

519.title: US sanctions network that helps ship Iranian oil to China
519.summary: The US treasury imposed sanctions on over a dozen individuals and firms accused of helping ship Iranian oil to China. Targets included entities in China, India, and the UAE. Treasury secretary Scott Bessent criticized Iran for using oil revenues to fund nuclear and missile programs. President Trump reiterated the US's stance against Iran's nuclear ambitions, stating the country cannot have a nuclear bomb, and warned of severe consequences if Iran harms him.

520.title: Why US plans to seize Venezuelan President's second plane Dassault Falcon 200
520.summary: The seizure of the plane comes just a week after President Donald Trump’s envoy for special missions, Richard Grenell, visited Caracas and met with Maduro to discuss the repatriation of Venezuelan nationals who illegally entered the United States. Grenell returned with six Americans who had been detained in Venezuela.
520.author: TOI World Desk

521.title: Russia welcomes USAID cuts, calls body 'machine for interfering'
521.summary: Russia praised the new US administration's decision to close USAID, calling the agency a "machine for interfering" in global affairs. The move followed Trump advisor Elon Musk's announcement to shut down the agency as part of efforts to reduce government size. USAID, which funded global health, development, and democracy initiatives, was accused by Russia of meddling in domestic politics, particularly in ex-Soviet states. The closure has faced criticism, especially from aid groups, who warn of disruptions in critical programs like HIV prevention.

522.title: Elon Musk says 'What's your name again? I forgot' to Tim Walz in X face-off
522.summary: "The richest man in the world is sitting at the Resolute desk, about to defund your public school. Trump should stop him," Kamala Harris' vice presidential candidate Walz wrote criticizing Elon Musk and his DOGE's interference in administrative matters against which several Democratic leaders have spoken out expressing concern. "What's your name again? I forgot," Elon Musk replied directly to Walz.
522.author: TOI World Desk

523.title: 'Politico' says it never received govt subsidy as Donald Trump, Elon Musk double down on USAID
523.summary: President Donald Trump, DOGE chief Elon Musk Thursday doubled down on Politico claiming that it received millions of dollars from the United States Agency for International Development (USAID) which the new administration wants to shut down as Politico issued a statement claiming that Politico has never been a beneficiary of government programs or subsidies.
523.author: TOI World Desk

524.title: France warns Russia of 'response' over journalist acccreditation
524.summary: France warned of possible retaliation against Russia after the country revoked press accreditation for French reporter Benjamin Quenelle, labeling it a "disguised expulsion." The French foreign ministry called the decision "unjustified and arbitrary," threatening a response if not reconsidered. Russia’s move followed France's refusal to issue visas to journalists from pro-Kremlin media, whom Paris accused of espionage. Le Monde condemned Russia's decision, noting that even during the Cold War, it maintained operations in Moscow.

525.title: Panama's president denies making a deal that US ships can transit the canal for free
525.summary: Panamanian President Jose Raul Mulino denied claims from the US state department that a deal had been reached allowing US warships to transit the Panama Canal for free. Mulino clarified that he had informed US secretary of defense Pete Hegseth that neither he nor Panama could waive transit fees. The Panama Canal authority also stated there were no adjustments to fees. The disagreement follows recent talks with US officials, including concerns over China's influence in the canal region.

526.title: Trump urges Americans to 'bring God back into our lives' in national prayer breakfast speech
526.summary: At the national prayer breakfast on Thursday, President Donald Trump shared how his relationship with religion deepened after surviving two failed assassination attempts last year. Reflecting on his near-death experience, he emphasized the importance of religion in life, stating, "You can't be happy without religion." Trump also called for a return of religion and God into Americans' lives, while expressing his commitment to religious liberty. The event, attended by bipartisan lawmakers, marks a longstanding tradition, with every US president participating since Dwight D Eisenhower in 1953.

527.title: Hamas executed gay members who raped Israeli male hostages, shocking document reveals
527.summary: Hamas executed 94 members from 2012 to 2019 for 'morality' violations, including homosexual conduct and child abuse. Accusations included religious and behavioral misconduct. The October 7, 2023, attacks reportedly involved sexual assaults on male Israeli victims, though unpublicized due to religious taboos.
527.author: TOI World Desk

528.title: What blue liquid is RFK Jr adding to his water on flight? Video sparks curiosity over Methylene Blue
528.summary: RFK Jr added a blue liquid to his water, suspected to be Methylene Blue, in a viral video taken on a flight. Social media users claimed that the bluw liquid mitigates radiation exposure and prevents colds, sparking discussions about his health. MMA fighter Vance Elrod cautioned against the high dose that Kennedy Jr apparently took in the video, despite recognizing its benefits for oxidative stress and autophagy.
528.author: TOI World Desk

529.title: Finland to ban Russian nationals from buying property: Minister
529.summary: Finland’s government has proposed a ban on real estate purchases by nationals from countries engaged in wars of aggression, effectively targeting Russian buyers. The move aims to protect national security by preventing potential intelligence and sabotage activities. Exceptions will be made for residents with long-term permits. The bill, expected to be voted on this spring, seeks to close loopholes that allow indirect property acquisitions.

530.title: Trump's bid to move Palestinians an 'existential threat' to Jordan
530.summary: Donald Trump's proposal to move Palestinians out of Gaza and have the US take control has sparked major concerns in Jordan, which sees it as an existential threat. Jordanian officials and analysts warn that such a move would destabilize the country, alter its demographics, and undermine its sovereignty. King Abdullah II has firmly rejected the plan ahead of his upcoming meeting with Trump. Despite Jordan’s reliance on US aid, lawmakers insist they will not compromise their national identity or accept forced displacement of Palestinians.

531.title: Donald Trump explains what exactly he wants to do with Gaza
531.summary: Donald Trump clarified his plan for the Gaza Strip, stating it would be turned over to the US by Israel after fighting concludes, with Palestinians resettled in safer communities. Trump emphasized no US soldiers would be involved, aiming to develop Gaza into a prosperous region. Trump's takeover statement led to a major pushback from Arab leaders while White House clarified that Trump did not mean a military takeover.
531.author: TOI World Desk

NAIROBI / BANGKOK, Feb 06 (IPS) - Why can’t there be education for every child? Why can’t there be healthcare for everyone who needs it? Why can’t everyone be freed from hunger and deprivation? Though these are promised to all as rights, people are repeatedly told that there is no money.

757.title: Haitian Government Faces Criticism for its Response to Gang Attack in Kenscoff
757.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Feb 05 (IPS) - The humanitarian situation in Haiti continues to deteriorate as armed gangs expand their control in Port-Au-Prince and escalate acts of violence throughout the nation. Due to heightened insecurity, civilian displacement has reached new peaks, with hunger, disease, and the economic crisis having grown worse. With access to basic services diminished, approximately 5.5 million Haitians are dependent on humanitarian aid for survival. However, relief efforts have been severely hampered due to safety risks, restricted mobility and the vast scale of needs.

Read the full story, “Haitian Government Faces Criticism for its Response to Gang Attack in Kenscoff”, on globalissues.org →

759.title: Why Trump’s Tariffs Can’t Solve America’s Fentanyl Crisis
759.summary:
Feb 05 (IPS) - Americans consume more illicit drugs per capita than anyone else in the world; about 6% of the U.S. population uses them regularly. One such drug, fentanyl – a synthetic opioid that’s 50 to 100 times more potent than morphine – is the leading reason U.S. overdose deaths have surged in recent years. While the rate of fentanyl overdose deaths has dipped a bit recently, it’s still vastly higher than it was just five years ago.

Read the full story, “Why Trump’s Tariffs Can’t Solve America’s Fentanyl Crisis”, on globalissues.org →

760.title: Pakistan: Freedom of Expression at Stake With New Cybercrime Law

He was referring to the recent amendment in the already existing cybercrime law, terming it a “wild” law which has been instituted to grapple with fake news among other online harms.
